channel.title: Javac++ - The ultimate Java compiling utility
channel.description:
Originally released by Blakeman8192
[hr]
This tool can be used to compile packaged applications without the need to specify every directory within the application to be invoked from the command-line (command-line compiler, Win batch files, etc. for those of you who do _not_ use an IDE.)
What this means is that if you don't like to use an integrated development environment (IDE) and you prefer the old-school command-line initialization and compiling, this tool is definitively for you, simply because if you download a server that has been repackaged and it does not come with a compiler ready for you, you can implement this tool with a few easy steps.
Say you were programming Hyperion, and you did not wish to use an IDE, and you're using javac++, this is what your batch file would look like:
[code=batch] java -jar javac++.jar src lib bin pause[/code]
There are three parameters that you need to figure out.
1. Where the source is (the .java files, usually named "src") 2. If you have any dependencies (libraries, usually named "dep", "deps", "lib" or "libs") 3. And finally the output directory. (usually named "bin" or "build")
Another thing is that you do _not_ need to specify your directory to your jdk, which is sometimes frustrating I can imagine.
Some of you who know about setting the environmental variables know that this can be done much more simple, but not everyone knows how / cares to do so. The only thing I take credit for is decompiling his older version and making it compatible with jdk-6 and jdk-7 and for re-uploading it (all of his posts were removed from Rune-Server and he account was removed here.)
If you have any further questions feel free to ask on this thread. :-)
Download: [URL=http://uppit.com/zzrrnayg7yg0/javac++.zip]javac++.zip - 4.3 MB[/URL]

item.title: Javac++ - The ultimate Java compiling utility
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:5, topic:482412”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=600648.msg4217563#msg4217563 date=1360458535]
Why did you post this if it’s not yours…
[/quote]

Why did you not read?

“The only thing I take credit for is decompiling his older version and making it compatible with jdk-6 and jdk-7 and for re-uploading it (all of his posts were removed from Rune-Server and he account was removed here.)”[/quote]

I skimmed through key phrases on the left side of the screen, sorry.
